benchmark_details.name: ROBOVERSE
benchmark_details.overview: ROBOVERSE is a comprehensive framework comprising a simulation platform, a synthetic dataset, and unified benchmarks for scalable and generalizable robot learning. It aims to enhance the performance of imitation learning, reinforcement learning, and world model learning, improving sim-to-real transfer through a standardized dataset and benchmark methodology.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a unified platform for robot learning, enabling systematic training and evaluation protocols while integrating datasets from various sources.

data.source: Various existing simulation environments and benchmarks; tasks and assets migrated from RLBench, Meta-World, and others.
data.annotation: Utilizes pre-existing annotations and constructs new tasks and demonstrations through migration and simulation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the percentage of successful task completions and the ability to generalize to unseen scenarios.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is interpreted based on the degree to which policies can adapt to varied conditions as defined in the benchmark protocol.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline results include comparisons with existing benchmarks such as Meta-World and RLBench.
methodology.validation: Robust testing within the ROBOVERSE environment across tasks, utilizing a 90/10 training/testing split for generalization evaluation.
